snippet: Bank of America agreed today to pay $187.5 million to settle charges by California state and local governments that it mishandled hundreds of millions of dollars of bond payments between 1978 and 1995.    The bank said it would compensate the stat...
lead_paragraph: Bank of America agreed today to pay $187.5 million to settle charges by California state and local governments that it mishandled hundreds of millions of dollars of bond payments between 1978 and 1995. The bank said it would compensate the state and 300 city governments and local agencies that accused it of systematically pocketing unclaimed bondholder payments that should have been returned to the authorities to use to build schools, hospitals and roads.
abstract: Bank of America agrees to pay $187.5 million to settle charges by California state and local governments that it mishandled hundreds of millions of dollars of bond payments between 1978 and 1995 (M)

headline.main: Bank of America Settles Suits From California
